   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   50:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   51:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   52:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   53:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   54:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   55: 
   56: groups() -> 
   57:     zip_groups().
   58: 
   59: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   60: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   61: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   62: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   63: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   64: 
   65: zip_groups() ->
   66: 
   67:     ZipGroup=
   68:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   69:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   70:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   71:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   72: 
   73:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   74:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   75:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   80: 
   81: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   82:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   83: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   84:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   85: 
   86: noz64(Z64Mode) ->
   87:     case string:split(atom_to_list(Z64Mode), "_") of
   88:         ["z64",Mode] ->
   89:             list_to_atom(Mode);
   90:         [_Mode] ->
   91:             Z64Mode
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: zip_testcases() ->
   95:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
   96: 
   97: zip64_testcases() ->
   98:     [unzip64_central_headers,
   99:      zip64_central_directory].
  100: 
  101: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  102:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  103:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  104: 
  105: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  110:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  111: 
  112:     case disc_free(PrivDir) of
  113:         error ->
  114:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  115:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  116:         N when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20) ->
  117:             ct:pal("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  118:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  119:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  120:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  121:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  122:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  123: 
  124:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  125:         N when N < 16 * (1 bsl 20) ->
  126:             ct:pal("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  127:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free"}
  128:     end;
  129: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  130:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  131:         true ->
  132:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  133:                 undefined ->
  134:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  135:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  136:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, noz64(Group)} | Config];
  137:                 _Zip ->
  138:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  139:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  140:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, noz64(Group)} | Config]
  141:             end;
  142:         false ->
  143:             Config
  144:     end.
  145: 
  146: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  147:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  148:     Config.
  149: 
  150: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  151:     UsesZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= zip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unzip,
  152:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  153:     UsesEMZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= emzip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unemzip,
  154:     Memsize = memsize(),
  155:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  156:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  157:        UsesEMZip andalso Memsize < 8 bsl 30 ->
  158:             {skip, "Testing emzip needs more that 8 GB of memory"};
  159:        true ->
  160:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  161:             file:del_dir_r(PrivDir),
  162:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  163:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  164:     end.
  165: 
  166: 
  167: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  168:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  169:     Config.
  170: 
  171: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  172: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  173: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  174: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  175:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  176:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  177: 
  178:     Record = 512,
  179:     Block = 20 * Record,
  180: 
  181:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  182:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  183:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  184:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  185:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  186: 
  187:     %% Clean up.
  188:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  189:     ok.
  190: 
  191: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  192:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  193:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  194:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  195: 
  196:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  197:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  198:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  199:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  200:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  201: 
  202:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  203:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  204:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  205:                     info = Info,
  206:                     offset = 0,
  207:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  208:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  209:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  210: 
  211:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  212:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  213:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  214: 
  215: 
  216:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  217:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  218: 
  219:     ok.
  220: 
  221: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  222:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  223:         true ->
  224:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  225:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  226:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  227:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  228:         _ ->
  229:             ok
  230:     end.
  231: 
  232: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  233:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  234: 
  235: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  236:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  237:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  238: 
  239: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  240:     receive
  241:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  242:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  243:         {Port, eof} ->
  244:             Port ! {self(), close},
  245:             receive
  246:                 {Port, closed} ->
  247:                     true
  248:             end,
  249:             receive
  250:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  251:                     ok
  252:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  253:                     ok
  254:             end,
  255:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  256:     end.
  257: 
  258: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  259:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  260: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  261:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  262: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  263:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  264: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  268:     unlink(Port),
  269:     exit(Port, die),
  270:     ct:fail(Reason).
  271: 
  272: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  273:     Cmd.
  274: %%     case os:type() of
  275: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  276: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  277: %%     end.
  278: 
  279: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  280: 
  281: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  282:     X = next_random(X0),
  283:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  284:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  285:         _ -> false
  286:     end;
  287: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  288:     true.
  289: 
  290: %% Generates a random byte list.
  291: 
  292: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  293:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  294: 
  295: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  296:     X = next_random(X0),
  297:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  298: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  299:     lists:reverse(Result).
  300: 
  301: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  302: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  303: 
  304: next_random(X) ->
  305:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  306: 
  307: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  308: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  309: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  310:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  311:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  312:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  313:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  314: 
  315:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  316: 
  317:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  318:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  319:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  320: 
  321:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  322: 
  323:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  324:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  325:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  326:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  327: 
  328:     %% Clean up.
  329:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  330: 
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  334: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  335: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  336:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  337:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  338:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  339:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  340: 
  341:     %% Create a zip archive
  342:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  343:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  344: 
  345:     %% Open archive
  346:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  347: 
  348:     %% List dir
  349:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  350: 
  351:     %% Get a file
  352:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  353:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  354:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  355:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  356:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  357: 
  358:     %% Get all files
  359:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  360:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  361:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  362: 
  363:     %% Close
  364:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  365: 
  366:     %% Clean up.
  367:     delete_files([Names]),
  368: 
  369:     ok.
  370: 
  371: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  372: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  373: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  374: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     %% Create a zip archive
  376:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  377:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  378: 
  379:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  380:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  381: 
  382:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  383:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  384: 
  385:     %% Clean up.
  386:     delete_files([Zip]),
  387: 
  388:     ok.
  389: 
  390: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  391:     Self = self(),
  392:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  393:     receive
  394:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  395:             ZipSrv
  396:     end.
  397: 
  398: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  399:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  400:     receive
  401:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  402:             true
  403:     after 1000 ->
  404:             false
  405:     end.
  406: 
  407: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  408: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  410:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  411:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  412: 
  413:     %% create a temp directory
  414:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  415:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  416: 
  417:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  418: 
  419:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  420:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  421: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  422: 
  423:     %% Verify.
  424:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  425:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  426: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  427: 		  FList),
  428:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  429: 		  RetList),
  430: 
  431:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  432:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  433: 
  434:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  435: 
  436:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  437:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  438: 
  439:     %% Verify.
  440:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  441:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  442: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  443: 		  FList2),
  444:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  445: 		  RetList2),
  446: 
  447:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  448:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  449:     ok.
  450: 
  451: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  452: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  453:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  454:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  455:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  456: 
  457:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  458:     %% clash.txt
  459:     %% ../clash.txt
  460:     %% ../above.txt
  461:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  462: 
  463:     %% create a temp directory
  464:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  465:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  466:     
  467:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  468:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  469:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  470: 
  471:     %% unzip in SubDir
  472:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  473: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  474: 
  475:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  476: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  477:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  478:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  479: 
  480:     %% clean up
  481:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  482:     
  483:      %% create the temp directory again
  484:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  485: 
  486:     %% unzip in SubDir
  487:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  488: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  489: 
  490:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  491: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  492:    
  493:     %% clean up
  494:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  495:     ok.
  496: 
  497: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  498: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  499:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  500:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  501:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  502: 
  503:     %% create a temp directory
  504:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  505:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  506: 
  507:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  508: 
  509:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  510: 
  511:     %% Verify.
  512:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  513: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  514: 		  FList),
  515:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  516:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  517:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  518:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  519:                           end
  520:                   end,
  521: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  522: 
  523:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  524:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  525:     ok.
  526: 
  527: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  528: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  529:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  530:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  531:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  532:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  533: 
  534:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  535:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  536: 
  537:     %% Create a zip archive
  538:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  539:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  540: 
  541:     %% Open archive
  542:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  543: 
  544:     %% List dir
  545:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  546: 
  547:     %% Get a file
  548:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  549:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  550:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  551: 
  552:     %% Get all files
  553:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  554:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  555:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  556: 
  557:     %% Close
  558:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  559: 
  560:     %% Clean up.
  561:     delete_files([Names]),
  562: 
  563:     ok.
  564: 
  565: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  566: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  567: 
  568:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  569:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  570: 
  571:     {ok,
  572:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  573:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  574: 
  575:     {ok,
  576:      [#zip_comment{},
  577:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  578:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  579:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  580:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  581:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  582: 
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  586: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  587:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  588: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  589:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  590:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  591: 
  592: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  593: char_seq(N, First) ->
  594:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  595: 
  596: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  597:     Result;
  598: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  599:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  600: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  601:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  602: 
  603: data_files() ->
  604:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  605:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  606:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  607:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  608:     create_files(Files),
  609:     Files.
  610: 
  611: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  612:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  613:     create_files(Rest);
  614: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  615:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  616:     create_files(Rest);
  617: create_files([]) ->
  618:     ok.
  619:

  624: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  625: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  626: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  627: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  628: %%     Dir.

  630: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  631: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  632:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  633:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  634:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  635:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  636:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  637:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  638:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  639:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  640:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  641:                   end,
  642:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  643:     ok.
  644: 
  645: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  646:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  647:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  648: 
  649: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  650:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  651: 
  652:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  653:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  654:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  655:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  656:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  657:     case What(Full) of
  658:         Expected ->
  659:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  660:         Other ->
  661:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  662:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  663:     end.
  664: 
  665: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  666: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  667:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  668:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  669:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  670:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  671:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),
  672: 
  673:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  674:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  675: 
  676:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  677:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  678: 
  679:     %% Verify.
  680:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) ->
  681:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),
  682:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  683:                               true ->
  684:                                   <<>> = B,
  685:                                   {ok, #file_info{ type = directory}} =
  686:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);
  687:                               false ->
  688:                                   {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  689:                           end
  690:                   end, FBList),
  691: 
  692:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  693:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  694: 
  695:     ok.
  696:

  723:

  750: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  751: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  752:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  753:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  754:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),

  776:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  777:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),

  780:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  781:

  783:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),

  786:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  787:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),

  789:     %% Verify.

  792:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  793: 
  794:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  795:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  796:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  797: 
  798:     %% Clean up.
  799:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  800:

  803: %% oac_files() ->
  804: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  805: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  806: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],

  809: 
  810: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  811: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  812: delete_files(List) ->
  813:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  814: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  815:     Cnt;
  816: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  817:     case file:delete(Item) of
  818:         ok ->
  819:             DelCnt = 1;
  820:         {error,eperm} ->
  821:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  822:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  823:             file:del_dir(Item);
  824:         {error,eacces} ->
  825:             %% We'll see about that!
  826:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  827:             case file:delete(Item) of
  828:                 ok ->
  829: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  830:                 {error,_} ->
  831:                     erlang:yield(),
  832:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  833:                     file:delete(Item),
  834:                     DelCnt = 1
  835:             end;
  836:         {error,_} ->
  837:             DelCnt = 0
  838:     end,
  839:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  840: 
  841: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  842: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  843:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  844:     Dir = "compress_control",
  845:     Files = [
  846:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  847:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  848:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  849:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  850:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  851:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  852:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  853:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  854:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  855:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  856:             ],
  857: 
  858:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  859: 			  Files,
  860: 			  [{compress, []}],
  861: 			  []),
  862: 
  863:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  864: 			  Files,
  865: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  866: 			  []),
  867: 
  868:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  869: 			  Files,
  870: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  871: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  872: 
  873:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  874: 			  Files,
  875: 			  [],
  876: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  877: 
  878:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  879: 			  Files,
  880: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  881: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  882: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  883: 
  884:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  885: 			  Files,
  886: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  887: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  888: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  889: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  890: 
  891:     ok.
  892: 
  893: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  894:     %% Cleanup
  895:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  896:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  897:     delete_files([Zip]),
  898:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  899: 
  900:     create_files(Files),
  901:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  902: 
  903:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  904:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  905:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  906:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  907:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  908: 
  909:     %% Cleanup
  910:     delete_files([Zip]),
  911:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  912: 
  913:     ok.
  914: 
  915: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  916:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  917:         case Kind of
  918:             dir ->
  919:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  920:             _   ->
  921:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  922:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  923:         end,
  924:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  925:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  926: 
  927:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  928:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  929:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  930:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  931:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  932:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  933:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  934:     end,
  935:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  936: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  937:     ok.
  938: 
  939: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  940:     false;
  941: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  942:     CompressOpt =
  943:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  944:             [] -> all;
  945:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  946:         end,
  947:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  948:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  949:     UncompressOpt =
  950:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  951:             [] -> Default;
  952:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  953:         end,
  954:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  955:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  956: 
  957: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  958:     case H of
  959:         all ->
  960:             extensions(T, H);
  961:         H when is_list(H) ->
  962:             extensions(T, H);
  963:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  964:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  965:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  966:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  967:         _ ->
  968:             extensions(T, Old)
  969:     end;
  970: extensions([], Old) ->
  971:     Old.
  972: 
  973: foldl(Config) ->
  974:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  975:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  976: 
  977:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  978:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  979:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  980:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  981:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  982:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  983:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  984:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  985:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  986: 	try
  987: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  988: 	catch
  989: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  990: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  991: 	end,
  992:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  993:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  994: 
  995:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
  996:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
  997:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
  998: 
  999:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1000:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1001: 
 1002:     ok.
 1003: 
 1004: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1005:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1006:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1007:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1008:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1009:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1010:                          ok
 1011:                  end,
 1012:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1013: 
 1014:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1015:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1016:                                                  ["none"]),
 1017:                         ok
 1018:                 end,
 1019:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1020: 
 1021:     ok.
 1022: 
 1023: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1024:     ok;
 1025: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1026:     try Bad() of
 1027:         ok ->
 1028:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1029:     catch
 1030:         C:R:Stk ->
 1031:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1032:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1033:     end.
 1034: 
 1035: unicode(Config) ->
 1036:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1037:         latin1 ->
 1038:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1039:         utf8 ->
 1040:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1041:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1042:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1043:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1044:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1045:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1046:             case has_zip() of
 1047:                 false ->
 1048:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1049:                 true ->
 1050:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1051:                         true ->
 1052:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1053:                             ok;
 1054:                         false ->
 1055:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1056:                     end
 1057:             end
 1058:     end.
 1059: 
 1060: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1061:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1062:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1063: 
 1064:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1065:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1066: 
 1067: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1068:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1069:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1070:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1071:     [begin
 1072:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1073:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1074:      end ||
 1075:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1076:     ok.
 1077: 
 1078: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1079:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1080:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1081:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1082:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1083:     {ok, Archive} =
 1084:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1085:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1086: 
 1087: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1088:     case test_zip1() of
 1089:         false ->
 1090:             ok;
 1091:         true ->
 1092:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1093:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1094:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1095:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1096:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1097:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1098:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1099:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1100:     end.
 1101: 
 1102: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1103:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1104:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1105:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1106:     ok.
 1107: 
 1108: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1109:     case test_zip1() of
 1110:         false ->
 1111:             ok;
 1112:         true ->
 1113:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1114:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1115:             Comment = [Char],
 1116:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1117:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1118: 
 1119:             {ok, _} =
 1120:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1121:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1122:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1123:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1124: 
 1125:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1126:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1127:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1128:     end.
 1129: 
 1130: test_zip1() ->
 1131:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1132: 
 1133: has_zip() ->
 1134:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1135: 
 1136: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1137:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1138:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1139: 
 1140: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1141:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1142:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1143:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1144:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1145:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1146:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1147:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1148:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1149:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1150:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1151:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1152:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1153:     ok.
 1154: 
 1155: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1156:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1157:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1158:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1159:     Comment = [9999999],
 1160:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1161:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1162: 
 1163: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1164:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1165:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1166:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1167:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1168: 
 1169: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1170:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1171:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1172:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1173:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1174:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1175:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1176:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1177:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1178:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1179:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1180:             ok;
 1181:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1182:     end.
 1183: 
 1184: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1185:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1186:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1187:              receive
 1188:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1189:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1190:                               Reciver()
 1191:              end
 1192:      end)().
 1193:     
 1194: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1195:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1196:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1197:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1198:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1199:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1200:     ok.
 1201: 
 1202: mode(Config) ->
 1203: 
 1204:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1205:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1206:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1207: 
 1208:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1209:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1210:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1211:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1212: 
 1213:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1214:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1215:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1216:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1217: 
 1218:     ?assertMatch(
 1219:        {ok, Archive},
 1220:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1221: 
 1222:     ?assertMatch(
 1223:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1224:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}},
 1225:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}} ]},
 1226:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1227: 
 1228:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1229:     ?assertMatch(
 1230:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1231: 
 1232:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1233:         true ->
 1234:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1235:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1236:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, ExecMode band 8#777),
 1237: 
 1238:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1239:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1240:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, DirMode band 8#777);
 1241:         false ->
 1242:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1243:             ok
 1244:     end,
 1245: 
 1246:     ok.
 1247: 
 1248: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1249: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1250: %%  * compressed size
 1251: %%  * uncompressed size
 1252: %%  * relative offset
 1253: %%  * starting disk
 1254: %%
 1255: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1256: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1257: 
 1258:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1259:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1260: 
 1261:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1262:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1263:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1264: 
 1265:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1266:     %% different header combinations.
 1267:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1268:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1269:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1270:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1271:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1272:     %%
 1273:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1274: 
 1275:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1276:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1277:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../medium.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1278:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1279:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1280:     ?assertMatch(
 1281:        {ok, Archive},
 1282:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1283:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1284:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1285:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1286: 
 1287:     %% Check that list archive works
 1288:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1289:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1290:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1291:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1292:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1293:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1294:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1295:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1296:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1297:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1298:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1299:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1300:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1301:          ]} =
 1302:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1303:     ok.
 1304: 
 1305: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1306: 
 1307:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1308:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1309:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1310:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1311:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1312: 
 1313:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1314:     lists:map(
 1315:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1316:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1317:               ?assertMatch(
 1318:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1319:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1320:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1321:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1322:           F(Name) ->
 1323:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1324:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1325:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1326: 
 1327:     ok.
 1328: 
 1329: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1330: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1331: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1332: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1333: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1334: %%
 1335: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1336: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1337: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1338: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1339: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1340: 
 1341:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1342:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1343:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1344: 
 1345:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1346: 
 1347:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1348:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1349:     lists:foreach(
 1350:       fun(I) ->
 1351:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1352:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1353:     ?assertMatch(
 1354:        {ok, Archive},
 1355:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1356: 
 1357:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1358:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1359: 
 1360:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1361:     ?assertMatch(
 1362:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1363:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1364:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1365:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1366:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1367: 
 1368:     ok.
 1369: 
 1370: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1371: %% mtime of the file
 1372: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1373:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1374:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1375:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1376:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1377: 
 1378:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1379:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1380:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1381: 
 1382:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1383:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1384: 
 1385:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1386:     ?assertMatch(
 1387:        {ok, Archive},
 1388:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1389: 
 1390:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1391:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1392:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1393: 
 1394:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1395:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1396:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1397: 
 1398:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1399:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1400:     %% are in precise.
 1401:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1402:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1403: 
 1404:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1405:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1406: 
 1407:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1408:     ?assertMatch(
 1409:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1410:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1411: 
 1412:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1413:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1414:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1415:                              }} =
 1416:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1417: 
 1418: 
 1419:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1420: 
 1421:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1422:         true ->
 1423:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1424:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1425: 
 1426:             ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1427:         false ->
 1428:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1429:             ok
 1430:     end,
 1431: 
 1432:     ok.
 1433: 
 1434: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1435: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1436: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1437: 
 1438:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep USE_EF_UT_TIME") of
 1439:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support extended timestamps"};
 1440:         _ ->
 1441:             PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1442:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1443:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1444:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1445: 
 1446:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1447:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1448:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1449: 
 1450:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1451:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1452: 
 1453:             ?assertMatch(
 1454:                {ok, Archive},
 1455:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1456: 
 1457:             %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1458:             %% the mtime will be correct here
 1459:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1460:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1461:                 zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1462: 
 1463:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1464:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1465:             ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1466: 
 1467:             ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1468: 
 1469:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1470:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1471: 
 1472:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1473:             ?assertMatch(
 1474:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1475:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1476: 
 1477:             {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1478:                                        mtime = UnZMtime,
 1479:                                        ctime = UnZCtime
 1480:                                      }} =
 1481:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1482: 
 1483:             ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1484: 
 1485:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1486:                 true ->
 1487:                     ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1488:                     ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1489: 
 1490:                     ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1491:                 false ->
 1492:                     %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1493:                     ok
 1494:             end,
 1495: 
 1496:             ok
 1497:     end.
 1498: 
 1499: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1500: 
 1501:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep STORE_UNIX_UIDs_GIDs") of
 1502:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support uid/gids"};
 1503:         _ ->
 1504: 
 1505:             PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1506:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1507:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1508:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1509: 
 1510:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1511:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1512:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1513: 
 1514:             ?assertMatch(
 1515:                {ok, Archive},
 1516:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1517: 
 1518:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1519:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1520:                 zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1521: 
 1522:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1523:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1524: 
 1525:             ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1526:             ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1527: 
 1528:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1529:             ?assertMatch(
 1530:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1531:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1532: 
 1533:             {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1534:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1535: 
 1536:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1537:                 true ->
 1538:                     ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1539:                     ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1540:                 _ ->
 1541:                     %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1542:                     ok
 1543:             end,
 1544: 
 1545:             ok
 1546:     end.
 1547: 
 1548: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1549: %%% Generic zip interface
 1550: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1551: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1552:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1553:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1554: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1555:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1556:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1557:     {ok, Archive};
 1558: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1559:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1560:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1561: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1562:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1563:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1564:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1565:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1566:           fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1567:                   AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1568:                   {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1569:                   {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1570:                       if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1571:                               {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1572:                               lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ Fn => <<>> },
 1573:                                              [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1574:                          Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1575:                               %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1576:                               %% the binary for files that are links to the same file.
 1577:                               %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1578:                               {[],
 1579:                                case file:read_link_all(AbsFn) of
 1580:                                   {ok, LinkFn} ->
 1581:                                       case maps:get(LinkFn, Cache, undefined) of
 1582:                                           undefined ->
 1583:                                               {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1584:                                               Cache#{ LinkFn => Data, Fn => Data };
 1585:                                           Data ->
 1586:                                               Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1587:                                       end;
 1588:                                   {error, _} ->
 1589:                                       {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1590:                                       Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1591:                               end}
 1592:                       end,
 1593:                   {[{Fn, maps:get(Fn, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1594:           end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1595:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1596: 
 1597: 
 1598: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1599:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1600: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1601:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1602:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1603:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1604:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1605:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1606:            lists:flatmap(
 1607:              fun(Ln) ->
 1608:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1609:                          nomatch -> [];
 1610:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1611:                      end
 1612:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1613: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1614:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1615:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1616:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1617: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1618:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1619:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1620:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1621:            [begin
 1622:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1623:                     $/ ->
 1624:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1625:                     _ ->
 1626:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1627:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1628:                 end,
 1629:                 F -- Cwd
 1630:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1631: 
 1632: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1633:     "" = cmd("cmp --silent "++Source++" "++Target++~s' || echo "files are different"').
 1634: 
 1635: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1636:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1637:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1638:     Res.
 1639: 
 1640: disc_free(Path) ->
 1641:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1642: 
 1643:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1644:     Partitions =
 1645:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1646:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1647: 
 1648:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1649:     %% path first.
 1650:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1651:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1652:         [] -> error
 1653:     end.
 1654: 
 1655: memsize() ->
 1656:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1657:         undefined ->
 1658:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1659:             Tot;
 1660:         Available ->
 1661:             Available
 1662:     end.
